p: Consequently, we argue that the ecosystem approaches to health framework, which recognize the inextricable linkage of humans, animals and their environment and social context (Forget and Lebel 2001; Charron 2012; Martin-Diaz et al. 2017) or health in social-ecological systems (Zinsstag et al. 2011) would offer a more comprehensive and broader context to address the effect of climate change on health.
